L: My name is Lauren. I work at Marketing and Communications at Moss. I have for over a year, a little over a year. To me, Bio-Filia, I always think of a comparison to Bio-Memocry. I can define the two by comparing and seeing what's different because Bio-Memocry is trying to recreate nature and then Bio-Filia is trying to create spaces that are more about nature, for nature, like built from love of nature, and desire to maintain it and preserve it rather than just mimic it, recreate it, more to appreciate it.

B: My name is Bala, I work at Moss for almost two years now and I'm a green designer. For me, Bio-Filia is just like others said, reconnecting with nature, taking a break from what we do every time or also sense of safeness when you're around something, basically giving you a relaxed feeling. Or a pause from what you easily do.

I: Hi, my name is Irini. I work for Moss as a green designer as well and plant specialists. For me, Bio-Filia is how you relate to the living elements that surround you and that you sort of connect. So to summarise , we are designing the study nook and we imagine this space to be multipurpose, mixed with social and focus and as well as a place to relax and immerse in biophilic design. I think one is actually using plants as a tuning because indoor spaces such as these university spaces are quite loud and using plants with different surfaces and root structures really dampens the sound and reduces reverb time and also the use of water and soil impacts echoes.

I think one is actually using plants as a tuning because indoor spaces such as these university spaces are quite loud and using plants with different surfaces and root structures really dampens the sound and reduces reverb time and also the use of water and soil impacts echoes.
